newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Morocco cancels camel festival over elections.
newsitem.headline: Morocco cancels camel festival over elections.

text.p: Morocco has unexpectedly cancelled a camel festival, one of the largest camel markets in the country and a major tourist attraction, a tourism ministry official said on Thursday.
It was cancelled because of elections which are due to be held for professional bodies, like chambers of commerce and unions.
The festival is normally held every July in the southern town of Guelimine, near the Atlantic coast, some 800 kms (500 miles) south of Rabat.

"Hundreds of camels are usually gathered in Guelimine and sports competitions organised in the presence of thousands of Western tourists...But this year the festival was cancelled for election reasons," the official said.
